alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knox; Laurel (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 8:24PM EST until January 13 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following areas, in south central Kentucky, Laurel and Whitley. In southeast Kentucky, Clay and Knox. * WHEN...Until midnight EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas is ongoing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 823 PM EST, Excessive runoff from 1 to 2 inches of rainfall that fell earlier continues to cause minor flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Williamsburg, Barbourville, Manchester, Indian Creek, Wilton, Dishman Springs, Arkle, Rossland, Bertha Station, Gray, Permon, Emmanuel, Lowell, Bentley Station, Garrich, Woodbine, Clate, Swan Lake, Moore Hill and King.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
